intro: Harrisia donae-antoniae, commonly known as the Antónica cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems that can grow up to 1 meter in height. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring well-drained soil and minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
